intro: Doronicum bauhini, commonly known as the Alpine goldcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are arranged in compact clusters at the top of the stems. Doronicum bauhini is well adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
